intro: Turanecio cariensis, commonly known as the Caribbean turanecio, is a rare flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying biodiversity. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this endangered species from habitat loss.
